Motivation

Fear of Failure    
Achievement Goal Theory Mastery/Performance; Appraoch/Avoid  
Grit Grit, Conscioentiousness,  Grit, Grit-Short
School Academic Motivation (AMS)  
Interest Situational, intrinsic  
Procrastination Academic Procrastination  
Boredom    
Self-Regulation Self-Regulated Learning (SRL)  

 Implicit Beliefs

Belonging Stereotype Threat, Belonging in School  
Intelligence Fixed, Growth/Malleable Growth Mindset (Dweck), "I" pronoun (De Castella & Byrne, 2015)
Nature of Knowledge Epistemic Beliefs  
Self-Control Willpower, Self-Control  MSLQ
Locus of Control  What is in charge of your life? LOCS (Nowicki-Strickland)
Value Utility Value, Self-Value, Boring but Important, Value of Education/School  
Personality Whether people can change  
Difficulty Sanctifying, Impossible, Important  
Cognition NFC, beliefs about enjoyment of cognition NFC (Cacioppo & Petty), NFC-Short (Roets & Van Hiel)
Self-Efficacy Academic self-efficacy, college self-efficacy  
New Experiences Openness to Experience  
Entitlement Academic Entitlement  
Metacognition Usefulness...  MSLQ?
Beliefs About Failure Who's fault, what caused  
Memory Photographic, Permanent, Fallible, etc. (stability bias)  
Studying Best way to, effective means/ineffective, Tendencies Desirable Difficulties Scale (Yan), MSLQ
Evaluating Learning Metacognitive Beliefs  
Beliefs about Future Optimistic, Pessimistic for self  

 Personality

Big 5 FFO and short version, or TIPI (Gosling 2003)  
Neuroticism    
Anxiety    
Narcissism    
Curiosity, Inquisitiveness  Open-minded thinking  AOT
Most salient identities Identity-Based Motivation  
Mindfulness   FFMQ, MAAS
Decision-Making Rely upon heuristics, or more analytical CRT (multiple versions)
Perspective-Taking Myside or otherside thinking bias ? Toplak?
Impact of Context to Decision-Making Propensity to rely more on context or logic for decision-making STSS (Novak & Hoffman), Rational-Experiential Inventory
Delay Discounting Consideration of future consequences CFC ()

 State (not trait)

Mindfulness Attention, Presence State MAAS
Depression Beck, alternative scales  
Life Satisfaction   SLS (Diener), Student LSS (Huebner), Student LSS - Brief (Huebner)
Need Satisfaction   (Ryan & Deci)
Recent Emotions   PANAS, Vitality (Ryan & Frederick)
Perceived Stress How stressed do you feel? PSS (Cohen et al 1983)
Learning Climate The learning climate questionairre LCQ
